ygData.subject: RE: Selos and trains underground
ygData.msgSnippet: Amen, was about to add my .02, but you said it well. Been playing for MONTHS, there are many areas I simply refuse to go to, cause I m NOT gonna spend forever
ygData.messageBody:
Amen, was about to add my .02, but you said it well.

Been playing for MONTHS, there are many areas I simply refuse to go to,
cause I'm NOT gonna spend forever just running back naked to get my corpse.



At 11:22 AM 11/30/99 -0800, you wrote:
>From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
>
>*sigh* NO. Don't make everyone bind in cities. Allow everyone to be bound
>anywhere.
>I tell you, as a caster in most of my active characters (druid, enchanter,
>wizard, bard)
>I would be HAPPY to bind someone outside of the cities if the game would
>allow
>me. I have no beef with tanks binding outside of cities. It would mean
>we could get back to our playing all that much faster. I've even run out to
>zone line
>in various city zones to bind people so they can be that much closer to
>where they are going
>(or because they are evil and can't go in further)
>
>Don't handicap everyone in some move of spite. Try to get stuff added to
>everyone.
>IMHO, it is ridiculous not to allow it. Perhaps make it a Yes-no thing like
>the
>revive. *shrug* :) So someone can't get bound somewhere they don't want to
>be
>bound.
>
>Faesong, level 10 Songweaver of Solusek ro, Test Server
>

>> There is no real need for it. And it's only used to exploit

>>

>> it there in a safer environment.
>>
>> 2) Raid of Vox/Nagafen. Need I say more? hehehe.
>>
>> 3) Shortcuts back into deep dungeon areas to kill X mob

>>
>> Those are the things I've seen, I bet there are 3 more
>> uses for the binding in dungeons which exploit one thing
>> or another. There is really no good reason to bind in
>> a dungeon to defend doing it. I mean they can bind right
>> outside the entrance, which is something non-casters wont
>> be able to do anyway. No binding in dungeons would elimate
